name: Mesna

indications.text: mesna injection indicated prophylactic agent reducing incidence ifosfamide-induced hemorrhagic cystitis .

contraindications.text: mesna injection may given fractionated dosing schedule three bolus intravenous injections single bolus injection followed two oral administrations mesna tablets outlined . dosing schedule repeated day ifosfamide administered . ifosfamide adjusted , ratio mesna ifosfamide maintained . ( 2 ) intravenous dosing schedule : 0 hours 4 hours 8 hours ifosfamide 1.2 g/m 2 - - mesna injection 240 mg/m 2 240 mg/m 2 240 mg/m 2 intravenous oral dosing schedule : 0 hours 2 hours 6 hours ifosfamide 1.2 g/m 2 - - mesna injection 240 mg/m 2 - - mesna tablets - 480 mg/m 2 480 mg/m 2 maintain sufficient urinary output , required ifosfamide treatment , monitor urine presence hematuria . ( 2.3 )

warningsAndPrecautions: mesna injection supplied follows : ndc mesna injection ( 100 mg per ml ) package factor 25021-201-10 1 gram per 10 ml multi-dose vial 1 vial per carton 25021-201-11 1 gram per 10 ml multi-dose vial 10 vials per carton
adverseReactions: mesna contraindicated patients known hypersensitive mesna excipients [ ( 5.1 ) ] .
indications_original: Mesna Injection is indicated as a prophylactic agent in reducing the incidence of ifosfamide-induced hemorrhagic cystitis.
contraindications_original: Mesna injection may be given on a fractionated dosing schedule of three bolus intravenous injections or a single bolus injection followed by two oral administrations of mesna tablets as outlined below. The dosing schedule should be repeated on each day that ifosfamide is administered.  When the dosage of ifosfamide is adjusted, the ratio of mesna to ifosfamide should be maintained. ( 2 ) Intravenous Dosing Schedule: 0 Hours 4 Hours 8 Hours Ifosfamide 1.2 g/m 2 - - Mesna injection 240 mg/m 2 240 mg/m 2 240 mg/m 2 Intravenous and Oral Dosing Schedule: 0 Hours 2 Hours 6 Hours Ifosfamide 1.2 g/m 2 - - Mesna injection 240 mg/m 2 - - Mesna tablets - 480 mg/m 2 480 mg/m 2 Maintain sufficient urinary output, as required for ifosfamide treatment, and monitor urine for the presence of hematuria. ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Mesna Injection is supplied as follows:

                  
                     
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           
                              NDC
                           
                           
                              Mesna Injection (100 mg per mL)
                           
                           
                              Package Factor
                           
                        
                        
                           25021-201-10

                           1 gram per 10 mL Multi-Dose Vial

                           1 vial per carton

                        
                        
                           25021-201-11

                           1 gram per 10 mL Multi-Dose Vial

                           10 vials per carton
adverseReactions_original: Mesna is contraindicated in patients known to be hypersensitive to mesna or to any of the excipients [see Warnings and Precautions (5.1)].
